title: Shaping various operants, various species (TEFC)
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Learning, Psychology o
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Conditioned response
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Psychology
description: Episode of Series "Behaviour Theory in Practice". Considers conditioning in six steps: shaping, adaptation, situation, motivation, operant level and final performance. These are illustrated by conditioned lever pressing by rats, high jumping by dogs, manipulation of a talking parrot and learning of handwriting by children.
